title: The weird and wonderful history of in-flight entertainment
text:
The history of in-flight entertainment (if you discount reading a book, having a conversation, or admiring the views) began almost a century ago. In August 1921, an Aeromarine Airways flying boat circled Lake Michigan while treating 11 passengers to a screening of ‘Howdy Chicago!’, a short film promoting the city.

It was a publicity stunt, of course – in-flight films didn’t become a regular fixture until much later – but it represented the birth of an aviation perk that now permits passengers to choose from dozens of movies on demand, browse the internet, or even watch live sport. Anyone who has ever survived a long-haul flight by watching 14 episodes of ‘Curb Your Enthusiasm’ owes a little debt of gratitude to this US trailblazer.
